definition: to bind a person's upper body, with arms tied behind the back and rope looped around the neck/to truss up
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to tie/bind or fasten together/to kidnap

sentences.english: If I spent any longer than that they would tie me to a large tire and whip me.
sentences.chinese: 如果時間長一點點，他們就把我五花大綁捆起來鞭打。

definition: to walk right into the trap
lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
the trick of injuring oneself to gain the enemy's confidence/CL:條|条[tiao2]
without a retreat route/caught in a dead end/having burned one's bridges
to open fire/to shoot a gun
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4
